statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: MD Baltimore Co 83, Maine 62
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Brian Hodges scored 19 points and Maryland-Baltimore County snapped a three-game losing streak by beating Maine 83-62 on Sunday. Jay Greene and Jerrell Dinkins added 16 points each for the Retrievers (7-10, 3-3 America East), who placed five players in double figures. Dinkins had 13 rebounds and Greene, UMBC's point guard, played all 40 minutes without committing a turnover. Rashard Turner led the Black Bears (7-11, 2-5) with 18 points, but was held scoreless in the second half after hitting six first-half 3-pointers. Ernest Turner scored 14 points and Phillipe Tchekane Bofia had 10 rebounds for Maine, which was deprived of a season-high third consecutive victory. The victory was the first for the Retrievers since being allowed back in their locker room on Wednesday. Coach Randy Monroe had punished the team for a lackluster effort in a Jan. 11 home loss to New Hampshire by banning them from the locker room for six days and not permitting players to wear team apparel. The game turned after Maine's Freddy Petkus was called for an intentional foul on Chris Pugh with 12:16 remaining in regulation and the game tied at 50. Pugh, who tumbled into the first row of the end zone bleachers, missed two free throws. But UMBC never trailed after Hodges scored a 3-pointer from the right corner with 11:54 left on the ensuing possession.
